IEmailRecoveryManager.RecoveryConfig","name":"recoveryConfig","type":"tuple"}],"name":"updateRecoveryConfig","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"verifier","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"verifierAddr","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"The underlying EmailAccountRecovery contract provides some base logic for deploying guardian contracts and handling email verification. This contract defines an implementation for email-based recovery. It is designed to provide the core logic for email-based account recovery that can be used across different account implementations. The core logic is agnostic to the account implementation and could be implemented as part of a smart account module, or on a smart account itself. EmailRecoveryManager defines \"what a valid recovery attempt is for an account\", and leaves defining \"how that recovery attempt is executed on the account\" to contracts implementing EmailRecoveryManager. A specific email command handler is also accociated with a recovery manager. A command handler defines and validates the recovery email commands. Developers can write their own command handlers to make specifc commands","errors":{"OwnableInvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)"}],"OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address)":[{"details":"The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation."}]},"kind":"dev","methods":{"acceptanceCommandTemplates()":{"details":"This is retrieved from the associated command handler. Developers can write their own command handlers, this is useful for account implementations which require different data in the command or if the email should be in a language that is not English.","returns":{"_0":"string[][] A two-dimensional array of strings, where each inner array represents a set of fixed strings and matchers for a command template."}},"addGuardian(address,uint256)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian and only if no recovery is in process","params":{"guardian":"The address of the guardian to be added","weight":"The weight assigned to the guardian"}},"cancelExpiredRecovery(address)":{"details":"Deletes the current recovery request associated with the given account if the recovery request has expired.","params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the recovery is being cancelled"}},"cancelRecovery()":{"details":"Deletes the current recovery request associated with the caller's account"},"changeThreshold(uint256)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian config and only if no recovery is in process","params":{"threshold":"The new threshold for guardian approvals"}},"completeRecovery(address,bytes)":{"details":"Validates the recovery request by checking the total weight, that the delay has passed, and the request has not expired. Calls the virtual `recover()` function which triggers recovery. This function deletes the recovery request but recovery config state is maintained so future recovery requests can be made without having to reconfigure everything","params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the recovery is being completed","recoveryData":"The data that is passed to recover the validator or account. recoveryData = abi.encode(validatorOrAccount, recoveryFunctionCalldata). Although, it is possible to design an account/module using this manager without encoding the validator or account, depending on how the `handler.parseRecoveryDataHash()` and `recover()` functions are implemented"}},"computeAcceptanceTemplateId(uint256)":{"details":"Encodes the email account recovery version ID, \"ACCEPTANCE\", and the template index, then uses keccak256 to hash these values into a uint ID.","params":{"templateIdx":"The index of the acceptance command template."},"returns":{"_0":"uint The computed uint ID."}},"computeEmailAuthAddress(address,bytes32)":{"details":"This function utilizes the `Create2` library to compute the address. The computation uses a provided account address to be recovered, account salt, and the hash of the encoded ERC1967Proxy creation code concatenated with the encoded email auth contract implementation address and the initialization call data. This ensures that the computed address is deterministic and unique per account salt.","params":{"accountSalt":"A bytes32 salt value defined as a hash of the guardian's email address and an account code. This is assumed to be unique to a pair of the guardian's email address and the wallet address to be recovered.","recoveredAccount":"The address of the account to be recovered."},"returns":{"_0":"address The computed address."}},"computeRecoveryTemplateId(uint256)":{"details":"Encodes the email account recovery version ID, \"RECOVERY\", and the template index, then uses keccak256 to hash these values into a uint256 ID.","params":{"templateIdx":"The index of the recovery command template."},"returns":{"_0":"uint The computed uint ID."}},"dkim()":{"details":"This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.","returns":{"_0":"address The address of the DKIM contract."}},"emailAuthImplementation()":{"details":"This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.","returns":{"_0":"address The address of the email authentication contract implementation."}},"extractRecoveredAccountFromAcceptanceCommand(bytes[],uint256)":{"details":"This is retrieved from the associated command handler.","params":{"commandParams":"The command parameters of the acceptance email.","templateIdx":"The index of the acceptance command template."}},"extractRecoveredAccountFromRecoveryCommand(bytes[],uint256)":{"details":"This is retrieved from the associated command handler.","params":{"commandParams":"The command parameters of the recovery email.","templateIdx":"The index of the recovery command template."}},"getAllGuardians(address)":{"details":"Return an array containing all the keys. O(n) where n <= 32 WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which could be quite expensive.","params":{"account":"The address of the account associated with the guardians"}},"getGuardian(address,address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account associated with the guardian","guardian":"The address of the guardian"},"returns":{"_0":"GuardianStorage The guardian storage details for the specified guardian and account"}},"getGuardianConfig(address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the guardian configuration is being retrieved"},"returns":{"_0":"GuardianConfig The guardian configuration for the specified account"}},"getPreviousRecoveryRequest(address)":{"details":"the previous recovery request is stored as this helps prevent guardians threatening the liveness of recovery attempts by submitting malicious recovery hashes before honest guardians correctly submit theirs. See `processRecovery` and `cancelExpiredRecovery` for more details","params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the previous recovery request details are being retrieved"},"returns":{"_0":"PreviousRecoveryRequest The previous recovery request for the specified account"}},"getRecoveryConfig(address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the recovery configuration is being retrieved"},"returns":{"_0":"RecoveryConfig The recovery configuration for the specified account"}},"getRecoveryRequest(address)":{"details":"Does not return guardianVoted as that is part of a nested mapping","params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the recovery request details are being retrieved"},"returns":{"currentWeight":"Total weight of all guardian approvals for the recovery request","executeAfter":"The timestamp from which the recovery request can be executed","executeBefore":"The timestamp from which the recovery request becomes invalid","recoveryDataHash":"The keccak256 hash of the recovery data used to execute the recovery attempt"}},"handleAcceptance((uint256,bytes[],uint256,(string,bytes32,uint256,string,bytes32,bytes32,bool,bytes)),uint256)":{"details":"This function validates the email auth message, deploys a new EmailAuth contract as a proxy if validations pass and initializes the contract.","params":{"emailAuthMsg":"The email auth message for the email send from the guardian.","templateIdx":"The index of the command template for acceptance, which should match with the command in the given email auth message."}},"handleRecovery((uint256,bytes[],uint256,(string,bytes32,uint256,string,bytes32,bytes32,bool,bytes)),uint256)":{"details":"Verify the provided email auth message for a deployed guardian's EmailAuth contract and a specific command template for recovery. Requires that the guardian is already deployed, and the template ID corresponds to the `templateId` in the given email auth message. Once validated.","params":{"emailAuthMsg":"The email auth message for recovery.","templateIdx":"The index of the command template for recovery, which should match with the command in the given email auth message."}},"hasGuardianVoted(address,address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the recovery request is being checked","guardian":"The address of the guardian to check voted status"},"returns":{"_0":"bool The boolean value indicating whether the guardian has voted on the recovery request"}},"isActivated(address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the activation status is being checked"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if the recovery request is activated, false otherwise"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"recoveryCommandTemplates()":{"details":"This is retrieved from the associated command handler. Developers can write their own command handlers, this is useful for account implementations which require different data in the command or if the email should be in a language that is not English.","returns":{"_0":"string[][] A two-dimensional array of strings, where each inner array represents a set of fixed strings and matchers for a command template."}},"removeGuardian(address)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian and only if no recovery is in process","params":{"guardian":"The address of the guardian to be removed"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"toggleKillSwitch()":{"details":"Can only be called by the kill switch authorizer"},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"updateRecoveryConfig((uint256,uint256))":{"details":"Validates and sets the new recovery configuration for the caller's account, ensuring that no recovery is in process.","params":{"recoveryConfig":"The new recovery configuration to be set for the caller's account"}},"verifier()":{"details":"This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.","returns":{"_0":"address The address of the verifier contract."}}},"title":"EmailRecoveryManager","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"CANCEL_EXPIRED_RECOVERY_COOLDOWN()":{"notice":"The cooldown period after which a subsequent recovery attempt can be initiated by the same guardian"},"MINIMUM_RECOVERY_WINDOW()":{"notice":"Minimum required time window between when a recovery attempt becomes valid and when it becomes invalid"},"acceptanceCommandTemplates()":{"notice":"Returns a two-dimensional array of strings representing the command templates for an acceptance by a new guardian."},"addGuardian(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Adds a guardian for the caller's account with a specified weight"},"cancelExpiredRecovery(address)":{"notice":"Cancels the recovery request for a given account if it is expired."},"cancelRecovery()":{"notice":"Cancels the recovery request for the caller's account"},"changeThreshold(uint256)":{"notice":"Changes the threshold for guardian approvals for the caller's account"},"commandHandler()":{"notice":"The command handler that returns and validates the command templates"},"completeRecovery(address,bytes)":{"notice":"Completes the recovery process for a given account. This is the forth and final core function that must be called during the end-to-end recovery flow. Can be called by anyone."},"computeAcceptanceTemplateId(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates a unique command template ID for an acceptance command template using its index."},"computeEmailAuthAddress(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Computes the address for email auth contract using the CREATE2 opcode."},"computeRecoveryTemplateId(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates a unique ID for a recovery command template using its index."},"dkim()":{"notice":"Returns the address of the DKIM contract."},"emailAuthImplementation()":{"notice":"Returns the address of the email auth contract implementation."},"extractRecoveredAccountFromAcceptanceCommand(bytes[],uint256)":{"notice":"Extracts the account address to be recovered from the command parameters of an acceptance email."},"extractRecoveredAccountFromRecoveryCommand(bytes[],uint256)":{"notice":"Extracts the account address to be recovered from the command parameters of a recovery email."},"getAllGuardians(address)":{"notice":"Gets all guardians associated with an account"},"getGuardian(address,address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the guardian storage details for a given guardian and account"},"getGuardianConfig(address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the guardian configuration for a given account"},"getPreviousRecoveryRequest(address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the previous recovery request details for a given account"},"getRecoveryConfig(address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the recovery configuration for a given account"},"getRecoveryRequest(address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the recovery request details for a given account"},"handleAcceptance((uint256,bytes[],uint256,(string,bytes32,uint256,string,bytes32,bytes32,bool,bytes)),uint256)":{"notice":"Handles an acceptance by a new guardian."},"handleRecovery((uint256,bytes[],uint256,(string,bytes32,uint256,string,bytes32,bytes32,bool,bytes)),uint256)":{"notice":"Processes the recovery based on an email from the guardian."},"hasGuardianVoted(address,address)":{"notice":"Returns whether a guardian has voted on the current recovery request for a given account"},"isActivated(address)":{"notice":"Checks if the acceptanceCommandTemplates().details: This is retrieved from the associated command handler. Developers can write their own command handlers, this is useful for account implementations which require different data in the command or if the email should be in a language that is not English.

returns._0: string[][] A two-dimensional array of strings, where each inner array represents a set of fixed strings and matchers for a command template.

addGuardian(address,uint256).details: This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian and only if no recovery is in process

params.guardian: The address of the guardian to be added
params.weight: The weight assigned to the guardian

cancelExpiredRecovery(address).details: Deletes the current recovery request associated with the given account if the recovery request has expired.

params.account: The address of the account for which the recovery is being cancelled

cancelRecovery().details: Deletes the current recovery request associated with the caller's account

changeThreshold(uint256).details: This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian config and only if no recovery is in process

params.threshold: The new threshold for guardian approvals

completeRecovery(address,bytes).details: Validates the recovery request by checking the total weight, that the delay has passed, and the request has not expired. Calls the virtual `recover()` function which triggers recovery. This function deletes the recovery request but recovery config state is maintained so future recovery requests can be made without having to reconfigure everything

params.account: The address of the account for which the recovery is being completed
params.recoveryData: The data that is passed to recover the validator or account. recoveryData = abi.encode(validatorOrAccount, recoveryFunctionCalldata). Although, it is possible to design an account/module using this manager without encoding the validator or account, depending on how the `handler.parseRecoveryDataHash()` and `recover()` functions are implemented

computeAcceptanceTemplateId(uint256).details: Encodes the email account recovery version ID, "ACCEPTANCE", and the template index, then uses keccak256 to hash these values into a uint ID.

params.templateIdx: The index of the acceptance command template.

computeEmailAuthAddress(address,bytes32).details: This function utilizes the `Create2` library to compute the address. The computation uses a provided account address to be recovered, account salt, and the hash of the encoded ERC1967Proxy creation code concatenated with the encoded email auth contract implementation address and the initialization call data. This ensures that the computed address is deterministic and unique per account salt.

params.accountSalt: A bytes32 salt value defined as a hash of the guardian's email address and an account code. This is assumed to be unique to a pair of the guardian's email address and the wallet address to be recovered.
params.recoveredAccount: The address of the account to be recovered.

computeRecoveryTemplateId(uint256).details: Encodes the email account recovery version ID, "RECOVERY", and the template index, then uses keccak256 to hash these values into a uint256 ID.

params.templateIdx: The index of the recovery command template.

dkim().details: This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.

returns._0: address The address of the DKIM contract.

emailAuthImplementation().details: This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.

returns._0: address The address of the email authentication contract implementation.

extractRecoveredAccountFromAcceptanceCom.details: This is retrieved from the associated command handler.

params.commandParams: The command parameters of the acceptance email.
params.templateIdx: The index of the acceptance command template.

extractRecoveredAccountFromRecoveryComma.details: This is retrieved from the associated command handler.

params.commandParams: The command parameters of the recovery email.
params.templateIdx: The index of the recovery command template.

getAllGuardians(address).details: Return an array containing all the keys. O(n) where n <= 32 WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which could be quite expensive.

params.account: The address of the account associated with the guardians
The address of the account associated with the guardian

returns._0: GuardianStorage The guardian storage details for the specified guardian and account

params.account: The address of the account for which the guardian configuration is being retrieved

returns._0: GuardianConfig The guardian configuration for the specified account

getPreviousRecoveryRequest(address).details: the previous recovery request is stored as this helps prevent guardians threatening the liveness of recovery attempts by submitting malicious recovery hashes before honest guardians correctly submit theirs. See `processRecovery` and `cancelExpiredRecovery` for more details

params.account: The address of the account for which the previous recovery request details are being retrieved

returns._0: PreviousRecoveryRequest The previous recovery request for the specified account

params.account: The address of the account for which the recovery configuration is being retrieved

returns._0: RecoveryConfig The recovery configuration for the specified account

getRecoveryRequest(address).details: Does not return guardianVoted as that is part of a nested mapping

params.account: The address of the account for which the recovery request details are being retrieved

returns.currentWeight: Total weight of all guardian approvals for the recovery request
returns.executeAfter: The timestamp from which the recovery request can be executed
returns.executeBefore: The timestamp from which the recovery request becomes invalid
returns.recoveryDataHash: The keccak256 hash of the recovery data used to execute the recovery attempt

handleAcceptance((uint256,bytes[],uint25.details: This function validates the email auth message, deploys a new EmailAuth contract as a proxy if validations pass and initializes the contract.

params.emailAuthMsg: The email auth message for the email send from the guardian.
params.templateIdx: The index of the command template for acceptance, which should match with the command in the given email auth message.

handleRecovery((uint256,bytes[],uint256,.details: Verify the provided email auth message for a deployed guardian's EmailAuth contract and a specific command template for recovery. Requires that the guardian is already deployed, and the template ID corresponds to the `templateId` in the given email auth message. Once validated.

params.emailAuthMsg: The email auth message for recovery.
params.templateIdx: The index of the command template for recovery, which should match with the command in the given email auth message.

params.account: The address of the account for which the recovery request is being checked
params.guardian: The address of the guardian to check voted status

returns._0: bool The boolean value indicating whether the guardian has voted on the recovery request

params.account: The address of the account for which the activation status is being checked

returns._0: bool True if the recovery request is activated, false otherwise

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

recoveryCommandTemplates().details: This is retrieved from the associated command handler. Developers can write their own command handlers, this is useful for account implementations which require different data in the command or if the email should be in a language that is not English.

returns._0: string[][] A two-dimensional array of strings, where each inner array represents a set of fixed strings and matchers for a command template.

removeGuardian(address).details: This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian and only if no recovery is in process

params.guardian: The address of the guardian to be removed

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

toggleKillSwitch().details: Can only be called by the kill switch authorizer

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateRecoveryConfig((uint256,uint256)).details: Validates and sets the new recovery configuration for the caller's account, ensuring that no recovery is in process.

params.recoveryConfig: The new recovery configuration to be set for the caller's account

verifier().details: This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.

returns._0: address The address of the verifier contract.

CANCEL_EXPIRED_RECOVERY_COOLDOWN().notice: The cooldown period after which a subsequent recovery attempt can be initiated by the same guardian

MINIMUM_RECOVERY_WINDOW().notice: Minimum required time window between when a recovery attempt becomes valid and when it becomes invalid

acceptanceCommandTemplates().notice: Returns a two-dimensional array of strings representing the command templates for an acceptance by a new guardian.

addGuardian(address,uint256).notice: Adds a guardian for the caller's account with a specified weight

cancelExpiredRecovery(address).notice: Cancels the recovery request for a given account if it is expired.

cancelRecovery().notice: Cancels the recovery request for the caller's account

changeThreshold(uint256).notice: Changes the threshold for guardian approvals for the caller's account

commandHandler().notice: The command handler that returns and validates the command templates

completeRecovery(address,bytes).notice: Completes the recovery process for a given account. This is the forth and final core function that must be called during the end-to-end recovery flow. Can be called by anyone.

computeAcceptanceTemplateId(uint256).notice: Calculates a unique command template ID for an acceptance command template using its index.

computeEmailAuthAddress(address,bytes32).notice: Computes the address for email auth contract using the CREATE2 opcode.

computeRecoveryTemplateId(uint256).notice: Calculates a unique ID for a recovery command template using its index.

dkim().notice: Returns the address of the DKIM contract.

emailAuthImplementation().notice: Returns the address of the email auth contract implementation.

extractRecoveredAccountFromAcceptanceCom.notice: Extracts the account address to be recovered from the command parameters of an acceptance email.

extractRecoveredAccountFromRecoveryComma.notice: Extracts the account address to be recovered from the command parameters of a recovery email.

getAllGuardians(address).notice: Gets all guardians associated with an account

getGuardian(address,address).notice: Retrieves the guardian storage details for a given guardian and account

getGuardianConfig(address).notice: Retrieves the guardian configuration for a given account

getPreviousRecoveryRequest(address).notice: Retrieves the previous recovery request details for a given account

getRecoveryConfig(address).notice: Retrieves the recovery configuration for a given account

getRecoveryRequest(address).notice: Retrieves the recovery request details for a given account

handleAcceptance((uint256,bytes[],uint25.notice: Handles an acceptance by a new guardian.

handleRecovery((uint256,bytes[],uint256,.notice: Processes the recovery based on an email from the guardian.

hasGuardianVoted(address,address).notice: Returns whether a guardian has voted on the current recovery request for a given account

isActivated(address).notice: Checks if the recovery is activated for a given account

killSwitchEnabled().notice: boolean flag for the kill switch being enabled or disabled

minimumDelay().notice: The minimum delay before a successful recovery attempt can be executed

recoveryCommandTemplates().notice: Returns a two-dimensional array of strings representing the command templates for email recovery.

removeGuardian(address).notice: Removes a guardian for the caller's account

toggleKillSwitch().notice: Toggles the kill switch on the manager

updateRecoveryConfig((uint256,uint256)).notice: Updates and validates the recovery configuration for the caller's account

verifier().notice: Returns the address of the verifier contract.
